Keywords: Dunes, Dune Migration, Satellite Imagery, Google Earth, Image Processing 
 
In several regions of the world, the motion of sand dunes, though it seems quite slow, can become a 
challenge or even a threat for human activities. Some engineering solutions are available for 
protecting the sites, such as methods for surveying the dune fields and estimate their migration rate.

Sand dunes are hills of sand with different forms and sizes, which can move. As complex systems 
of particles, the dunes and their motion have attracted several experimental studies in the past [5,6] 
and recently [7], such as many numerical simulations [8-12]. Let us remember that the first 
systematic study of the motion of dunes was due to Ralph Bagnold, who during 1940s did 
measurements directly on natural dunes, but also experiments in wind tunnels [13].
